definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: He is all are welcome to shine on all of the lists to accept, several turn down start to be slanting pouring.
sentences.chinese: 他來者不拒照單全收，幾圈下來開始歪歪倒倒。

sentences.english: Wood is indiscriminate in his choice of friends as well as enemies.
sentences.chinese: 伍德不論選擇朋友還是敵人都是隨隨便便，來者不拒。

sentences.english: Dr. Hu keeps open house on Sundays. Nobody then is refused entrance to his house.
sentences.chinese: 每逢週日，胡博士家的大門都會敞開，來者不拒。

sentences.english: Antarctic octopuses eat a wide variety of animals, from clams to fish.
sentences.chinese: 南極章魚的食譜寬泛，從蛤蚌到魚類皆來者不拒。

sentences.english: Panama is indeed now far removed from its erstwhile financial free-for-all.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，現在巴拿馬金融業遠非過去的來者不拒。

sentences.english: He would keep open house and entertain like a prince.
sentences.chinese: 他要大宴賓客，來者不拒，像王公貴族一樣。

definition: to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
